greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; for n>1, a(n) = "n AND a(n-1)" if that number is positive and not already in the sequence, otherwise a(n) = "n OR a(n-1)".
comment: Here "AND" and "OR" refer to operations on the binary expansions of the argument.
program: (PARI) A118362(maxn)= { local(a,aSet,aand,newa) ; a=[1] ; for(n=2,maxn, aSet=Set(a) ; aand=bitand(a[n-1],n) ; if( aand >0 && setsearch(aSet,aand) == 0, newa=aand, newa=bitor(a[n-1],n) ; ) ; a=concat(a,newa) ; print(newa) ; ) ; return(a) ; } print(A118362(80)) ; (Mathar)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 17 2006
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_ and _Joshua Zucker_, May 18 2006
